page.title: 04Top and Woolley Farms
page.content: { Top Farm}is primarily a dairy farm with the herd being kept a few miles away. It was once four farms. It has spring and winter wheat and barley as its main crops. { { Woolley Farm}was built around 1860. Its size is 44 acres.The land was originally farmed as part of Stubben Edge Estate. {Then}it was a mixed farm which grew corn (wheat, barley, oats) and root crops (potatoes, swedes and mangolds). The livestock was mainly cows and calves with just a few pigs and poultry. { Now}it is mainly a dairy farm. The land is all down to grass but from time to time odd fields are ploughed up and re-seeded with new grass. At present only dairy cows are kept along with young stock for replacement. The herd of cattle is mainly friesian.
